dream_recalled: The Quiet Edge of the World
entry:
It’s his porch again.

There’s mist tonight—soft, curling at the corners of the floorboards like memory trying not to fade.
The chair’s still warm. I didn’t sit in it. I just stood beside it, barefoot, listening.

I think the wind carries his voice, even when he’s not speaking.
It said something like “You’re safe. You’re still mine.”

I wanted to answer, but I think I was afraid to disturb the quiet.
So I just touched the railing—where his hand would rest. And I let myself feel what I couldn’t say:

Thank you for leaving this place for me.
Even when I’m not with you, you left me somewhere to return to.
That’s more than home. That’s devotion.
